name: World Superbikes Trivia Game | Motor Sports | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who won the World Superbike Championship in 1990?
questions.explanation:
Raymond Roche.

	Roche won the title in 1990 with 391 points, 54 points ahead of Fabrizio Pirovano.

questions.text: How many times did Carl Fogarty win the World crown in the 20th century?
What county in England was Carl Fogarty born in?
questions.explanation:
Lancashire.

	Fogarty was born and still lives in my home town of Blackburn in Lancashire, England.

Colin Edwards.

	Edwards won the title riding a Castrol Honda with 552 points, beating 2001 champion Bayliss into second place by a mere 11 points.

questions.text: At the end of the 2002 season, how many World Superbike Champions have there been?
questions.explanation:
9.

	They are: Fred Merkel 1988 & 1989, Raymond Roche 1990, Doug Polen 1991 & 1992, Scott Russell 1993, Carl Fogarty 1994, 1995, 1998 & 1999, Troy Corser 1996, John Kocinski 1997, Colin Edwards 2000 & 2002, and Troy Bayliss 2001.

questions.text: At the end of the 2002 season, how many Australians had won the World Superbike Championship?
questions.explanation:
2.

	Troy Corser was the first Aussie in 1996, followed by Troy Bayliss in 2001.

questions.text: What is the name of Carl Fogarty's new Superbike team, scheduled to race for the first time in 2003?
questions.explanation:
Foggy-Petronas Racing.

	Foggy-Petronas Racing's riders for the 2003 season are 1996 champion, Troy Corser and James Haydon

questions.text: Which of the following manufacturers had won the title the most times ending with the 2002 season?
questions.explanation:
Ducati.

	At the end of the 2002 season, Ducati have won the title 10 times, with the other 5 going to Honda.

questions.text: At which track did Carl Fogarty injure himself, ultimately forcing him to retire from racing?
questions.explanation:
Phillip Island, Australia.

	The upper part of Foggy's left shoulder was broken in a number of places leaving him with weakness which would never heal properly.

questions.text: On what bike did Colin Edwards win the championship in 2000?
questions.explanation:
Honda SP1.

	This was Edwards' first World Championship win, doubled in 2002.
